text:
The treetop suspension bridge hike with all the monkeys was easily the 2nd best thing we did while spending 12 nights in Singapore. And it was free.

The best thing was the Bayfront walk at night. Seeing all the futuristic buildings' liite up was magical. We walked from the Merlion, around Marina Bay through the amazing 3 tower hotel over the Helix bridge. The we watched the spectacular sound and light show at Gardens by the Bay supergrove trees, followed by the Specter Lazer light & water show in front of the hotel. All of it amazing!

Natural trekking with lots of stones and steps. Small cute monkeys around the whole park but they don't attack. Just keep plastic bags and food out of sight. Water coolers are available outside most restrooms which is great to refill at every stop. Take note there's no vending machine at all. Overall tiring but satisfying to burn some calories.

🌟 Breathtaking Adventure at MacRitchie TreeTop Walk! 🌿

If you love nature, hiking, and stunning views, the MacRitchie TreeTop Walk is a must-visit in Singapore! 🌳

✅ Scenic Suspension Bridge– Walking 25 meters above the forest floor gives you an incredible bird’s-eye view of the lush canopy. Perfect for photos! 📸
✅ Serene & Peaceful– Surrounded by rich biodiversity, it’s a great escape from the city buzz. Listen to birds, spot monkeys, and enjoy the fresh air. 🐒🦜
✅ Great Exercise– The hike to the bridge (about 30-45 mins from MacRitchie Reservoir) is moderately challenging but rewarding. Wear comfy shoes! 👟
✅ Free Entry!– One of Singapore’s best nature experiences without spending a dime.

⚠️ Tips:
- Go early to avoid crowds and heat. ☀️
- Bring water and mosquito repellent. 🚰🦟
- The bridge is one-way, so plan your route ahead.

Final Verdict: A fantastic outdoor adventure for nature lovers and fitness enthusiasts. Whether you're a local or tourist, this is a hidden gem worth exploring! 🌍💚

**Rating:** ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

*#MacRitchie #TreeTopWalk #SingaporeNature #HikingSG #ExploreSingapore*

This hiking trail offers an incredible adventure through the forest, where you’ll encounter various wildlife, especially monkeys, giving you a true "into the wild" experience. The area features several trails with varying difficulty levels, ensuring there's something for everyone. The highlight of the hike is the tree-top walk, offering stunning views along the way.

It’s not that bad. Most of the trail is from Easy to Moderate. Those runners running at the trail can be so selfish, impatient and expect others (walkers) to make way for them automatically. Other than that, fresh air, sounds of jungle can be so healing.
